LA Flu Season Prep: How IV Therapy Can Help

February 26, 2025•Immunity IV LA

Flu Season in Los Angeles

While LA doesn't experience harsh winters, flu season still hits. From November through March, influenza cases rise across Los Angeles County. For busy professionals, parents, and anyone who can't afford downtime, prevention matters.

How IV Therapy Supports Flu Season Defense

Rapid Nutrient Delivery

When flu season arrives, your immune system needs support fast. IV therapy delivers immune-supporting nutrients directly to your bloodstream—no waiting for digestion.

Key Immune Nutrients

  • High-Dose Vitamin C: Supports white blood cell function and may reduce illness duration.
  • Zinc: Essential for immune cell development. Studies suggest zinc may help the body fight off viruses.
  • Hydration: Proper hydration supports every aspect of immune function.
  • B Vitamins: Support energy levels when you need them most.

When to Get an Immune IV During Flu Season

  • Early season: Build up your defenses before flu peaks
  • Exposure: After being around someone sick
  • First symptoms: At the earliest sign of feeling run down
  • Recovery: To bounce back faster if you do get sick

LA-Specific Flu Season Tips

  • Stay hydrated: LA's dry climate compounds dehydration risks.
  • Watch for early signs: Fatigue, sore throat, body aches.
  • Combine strategies: IV therapy + flu shot + good hygiene.

Who Benefits Most

  • Healthcare workers
  • Teachers and childcare workers
  • Business professionals
  • Frequent travelers
  • Anyone with high exposure risk

Mobile IV: No Exposing Yourself to More Germs

One advantage of mobile IV therapy? You don't sit in a waiting room full of sick people. We come to your home, hotel, or office—reducing your exposure while boosting your immunity.

Book Your Flu Season Prep

Prepare for flu season with immune-boosting IV therapy. Schedule your session anywhere in Los Angeles.
